title: The Gorman Paradox: Where Are All the AI-Generated Apps?
description: Hacker News discussion exploring the discrepancy between AI coding capabilities and the lack of widely deployed AI-generated applications. The community debates whether this indicates limitations in current AI tools or other barriers to adoption.
author: Hacker News Community

title: JustHTML is a fascinating example of vibe engineering in action
description: Simon Willison analyzes JustHTML, a new Python library for parsing HTML by Emil Stenstr√∂m. He examines how it represents both a useful tool and an example of 'vibe engineering' - software development driven by intuition and iterative refinement rather than rigid formal specifications.
author: Simon Willison

title: In many advanced software teams, developers no longer write the code directly
description: Discussion on Hacker News about the shift in advanced software teams where developers primarily review and refine AI-generated code rather than writing it from scratch. This represents a fundamental change in the software development workflow.
author: Hacker News Community

title: Best Open Models in December 2025
description: Reddit community roundup highlighting MiniMax M2 as the top open model built specifically for coding and agentic workflows, with GLM 4.6 noted as a solid alternative for development tasks.
author: r/LLM Community

title: LLMs Can Understand Base64 Encoded Instructions
description: Reddit discussion revealing that major LLMs (Gemini, ChatGPT, Grok) can understand and process Base64 encoded non-human readable text prompts, raising implications for prompt engineering and model capabilities.
author: r/artificial Community
